t: Psalm 51
To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bathâ€“sheba.
Have*p mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
Wash*p me thoroughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
For*p I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.
Against*p thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.
Behold,*p I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.
Behold,*p thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.
Purge*p me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Make*p me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
Hide*p thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
Create*p in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
Cast*p me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.
Restore*p unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.
Then*p will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
Deliver*p me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
O*p Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.
For*p thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.
The*p sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
Do*p good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
Then*p shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
